Comment:
Cash flow ain‚Äôt just king, queen, and ace; it‚Äôs the entire damn royal court. 

Uber‚Äôs saga proves what most founders forget: if your vendors and partners can‚Äôt pay rent, they don‚Äôt care about your ‚Äòvision,‚Äô they care about money in their hand yesterday. 

Dmart gets it; pay fast, play smart, win big. Here‚Äôs a new angle: startups obsess over burn rate and runway but ignore the dark art of crafting a cash flow ecosystem where everyone‚Äôs survival is synced. 

The real MVPs don‚Äôt just hustle for customers; they hustle to keep their entire value chain solvent and smiling. Lesson? Your cash flow game is your brand‚Äôs chrome armor; don‚Äôt let it rust.

Comment: Avik Ashar Cash flow truly is the lifeblood of any business, and your Uber example highlights an often overlooked challenge for gig workers. Managing inflows and outflows effectively isn‚Äôt just about survival‚Äîit‚Äôs a foundational strategy for growth and resilience.

Headline: Growth Strategist & Business Builder | GTM, Product, Partnerships | Founder @ Conwert.in | Fintech, Proptech, F&B | Ex-EnKash, OYO, IWG | UCLA PGP
Comment:
We often think that tech or sales is the biggest hurdle for growth for a business. But it is, more often than not - cash flow. Imagine putting critical campaigns, travel, inventory or something essential on hold because of cash flow. That's not good for business Avik Ashar.
The reason why so many B2B lending fintechs have sprung up is to solve this cash flow problem.
